intro: Schiedeella durangensis, commonly known as the Durango mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as the ocotillo. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. Schiedeella durangensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
